articles.description: Steve Clarke's Scotland are close to a watershed moment as they prepare to play Spain with a place at Euro 2024 at stake, writes Scott Mullen.
articles.title: 'Scotland on verge of watershed moment in Spain'

articles.description: Charlie Savage will stay with Wales' senior squad after a "dream" debut in Wednesday's 4-0 friendly win over Gibraltar.
articles.title: Savage stays with Wales squad after 'dream' debut

articles.description: The Football Association is unlikely to light the Wembley arch in the colours of the Israel flag because of the fear of a backlash from some communities.
articles.title: FA unlikely to light Wembley arch with Israel colours

articles.description: Conrad Smith and Richard Kahui once had a dream to represent the All Blacks, and they soon learned of the legacy that was left for them.
articles.title: The 'little black book' behind every All Black

articles.description: Glasgow City's hopes of reaching the Women's Champions League group stage are all but over after being blown away by Norwegian champions SK Brann.
articles.title: Glasgow City routed by Brann in Champions League

articles.description: Captain Rohit Sharma's scintillating century leads India to an emphatic eight-wicket World Cup defeat of Afghanistan in Delhi.
articles.title: Rohit century leads India to win over Afghanistan

articles.description: Birmingham City appoint former England captain Wayne Rooney as their new manager on a three-and-a-half-year deal.
articles.title: Birmingham City appoint Rooney as manager

articles.description: Captain Rohit Sharma's scintillating century sprints India to an emphatic eight-wicket World Cup defeat of Afghanistan in Delhi.
articles.title: Rohit ton races India to win over Afghanistan

articles.description: Olympic gold medallist Mary Lou Retton is "fighting for her life" in intensive care with a "rare form of pneumonia", her daughter says.
articles.title: Former Olympic champion Retton 'fighting for life'

articles.description: South Africa legend Allan Donald reveals his years of hurt and torment after his role in the "epic movie" which was the 1999 World Cup semi-final.
articles.title: Therapy, Beckham & a crying child - Donald's 1999 torment
